page.title: 05Principal Features cont.
page.content: {Hillesley Post Office.}This is in the converted front room of a house in the High Street. It is also a general store. There has been a post office here since 1900. {Yew Tree Garage, Hillesley.}The garage sells Butlers petrol, they get 50-100 customers a week. They have deliveries once a week. They sell sweets, drinks, lollies, petrol and tyres. They do small repairs to cars. {The Fleece Inn.}The Inn is 200 years old. It's most popular meal is steak and kidney pie. The inn was called 'The Fleece' because it is in the Cotswolds, and the Cotswolds are popular for sheep. They sell about 11 barrels of beer a day. {The Portcullis, Licensed Restaurant. The house is 400 years old, it used to be a public house but is now only a restaurant. It's said to have a ghost.
